title: PostgreSQL DROP TABLE

metadata.description: Learn about PostgreSQL DROP TABLE with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
The DROP TABLE Statement
The
DROP TABLE
statement is used to drop an existing table in a database.
Note:
Be careful before dropping a table.
Deleting a table will result in loss of all information stored in the table!
The following SQL statement drops the existing table
cars
:
Example
Delete the
cars
table:
DROP TABLE cars;
Result
DROP TABLE
Display Table
To check the result we can display the table with this SQL statement:
Example
SELECT * FROM cars;
Which will result in an error, because the
cars
table no longer exists:
Result
ERROR: relation "cars" does not exist
LINE 1: SELECT * FROM cars;
^

★
+1

What is PostgreSQL DROP TABLE

The DROP TABLE Statement

DROP TABLE
statement?
options: used to drop an existing table in a database
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of PostgreSQL DROP TABLE

The DROP TABLE Statement
The
DROP TABLE
statement is 'used to drop an existing table in a database'.

summary: This tutorial covers PostgreSQL DROP TABLE concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PostgreSQL DROP TABLE effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PostgreSQL DROP TABLE and how to apply it in your projects.
